questions.question: What is the empirical formula of FJU-23-H2O?
What is the set voltage for the RRAM device based on FJU-23-H2O?
How does the ON/OFF ratio of FJU-23-H2O compare to most MOF materials?
questions.answer: The ON/OFF ratio of 105 for FJU-23-H2O is higher than the values for most of the MOF materials.

questions.question: What is the role of the switched hydrogen bond pathway in FJU-23-H2O's resistive switching mechanism?
questions.answer: The electrical bistability of FJU-23-H2O originates from the switching of O1w─H1w1⋯O11/O31 hydrogen bonds driven upon the bias.

questions.question: Is FJU-23-H2O the first MOF to exhibit both rectifying and resistive switching effects?
questions.answer: Yes, FJU-23-H2O is the first single material to exhibit both resistance and rectification effects.

questions.question: What is the rectification ratio of the FJU-23-H2O device?
True or False: The set voltage of FJU-23-H2O is lower than other ion transport–induced RRAMs.
True or False: FJU-23-D2O shows a nonvolatile resistance switching behavior similar to FJU-23-H2O.
questions.answer: False, FJU-23-D2O shows a volatile resistance switching behavior.

questions.question: What is the potential storage density of FJU-23-H2O if its hexagonal channels are alternated as RRAM cell?
questions.answer: An ultrahigh storage density of 17.5 TB/cm2 can be realized.

questions.question: True or False: The switching mechanism of FJU-23-H2O is attributed to metal ion migration.
questions.answer: False, the switching mechanism is attributed to the turn ON/OFF of the chiral proton channels with the switched hydrogen bond pathway.

questions.question: What is the compliance current (ICC) used in the I-V measurements of FJU-23-H2O?
How does the conductivity of FJU-23-H2O change with the application of dc voltages?
questions.answer: The conductivity of FJU-23-H2O sharply rises 32-fold upon increasing the dc voltage to 0.2 V, indicating a voltage-gated effect.

questions.question: True or False: FJU-23-H2O requires an electroforming process for its resistive switching behavior.
questions.answer: False, FJU-23-H2O shows an electroforming-free resistive switching behavior.

questions.question: What is the activation energy value (Ea) for proton conduction in FJU-23-H2O under a dc voltage of 0.5 V?
True or False: The ON/OFF ratio of the FJU-23-H2O device decreases significantly during the cyclic switching operation.
questions.answer: False, the ON/OFF ratio remains more than 105 during the cyclic switching operation.

questions.question: What is the role of proton carriers in the resistive switching of FJU-23-H2O?
questions.answer: Proton carriers, having smaller ionic radius and larger electromobility, play an important role in reducing the set voltage and increasing the ON/OFF ratio of the device.

questions.question: True or False: FJU-23-H2O's resistive switching device can retain its low resistance state (LRS) for more than 104 seconds.
What is the crystal system of FJU-23-H2O?
True or False: The resistive switching behavior of FJU-23-D2O is nonvolatile and similar to FJU-23-H2O.
questions.answer: False, FJU-23-D2O shows a volatile resistive switching behavior, unlike the nonvolatile behavior of FJU-23-H2O.

questions.question: How does the set voltage of FJU-23-H2O compare to the set voltage required for FJU-23-D2O?
questions.answer: The set voltage for FJU-23-H2O is significantly lower than the set voltage required for FJU-23-D2O, which ranges from 56.5 to 99.5 V.
